page.title: 09Top Hall Farm-Thorpe Salvin
page.content:
Sheet 2.
The{Farming Year}starts in September when the land is ploughed, cultivated and sown. This involves three or four men with tractors and machinery, ploughing, cultivating and drilling. At this time of year we work from 7am to 9pm whenever it is not raining. The {first crop}to sow is{oilseed rape,} {followed}by{winter wheat}and{winter {barley.}In October the potatoes are lifted and this land is then sown with wheat. {Winter}is a quiet time on the arable farm, time is spent repairing machinery and getting it ready for spring work. {Spring}work starts in March when the soil begins to dry. On days when it is not raining{fertiliser}is put on the corn and oilseed. {CONTINUED...
